title: Ticket #2439: crash in FileLock::CreateHashName()
description:
The OSG glidein factory at UCSD encountered a problem in which the schedd crashed whenever it tried to write to a specific userlog with the following name: 

    /var/gfactory/clientlogs/user_ferenci/glidein_Production_v4_0/entry_CMS_T3_US_UMiss_umiss001/condor_activity_20110816_EngageVO-submit3-v1_0.main.log

realpath converts this to the following: 

    /glidein01/gfactory/glideindata/clientlogs/user_ferenci/glidein_Production_v4_0/entry_CMS_T3_US_UMiss_umiss001/condor_activity_20110816_EngageVO-submit3-v1_0.main.log

The hash computed in FileLock::CreateHashName() for the above name is 4604 in a 32-bit compiled version of condor. This causes the following loop to be entered, and that leads to a segfault in strcpy: 

    while (strlen(hashVal) < 5)
        sprintf(hashVal+strlen(hashVal), "%s", hashVal);

The workaround for this problem is to configure CREATE_LOCKS_ON_LOCAL_DISK=False
remarks:

I accidentally checked this patch into V7_6_3-branch, thinking that 7.6.3 had not been released yet. The fix was merged to V7_6-branch, so it will be released in 7.6.4.
